item.title: Git Tips - Discard local changes | Git in-use
item.description: TL;DR: Reset to the last commit state. My favorite commands (just about it easy to type) 1git checkout . 2 3git reset --hard HEAD Sometimes, in developer life, there are some cases that you might want to revert back all changes made to your feature branch. For example: You are coding on a feature/bug fixing, but then realizing that you went for the wrong way and wanted to start it again in the brand new code.
